channel.title: R on OmicX
channel.description: Recent content in R on OmicX

item.title: Install R and RStudio Using Scoop
item.description:
• Kindly provided by Xu Meng.

This post descripts the way to install R and Rstudio in Windows using Scoop.

item.title: Check and Upgrade Bioconductor Packages
item.description: A R version supports more than one version of Bioconductor. To take advantange of new features, users have to update Bioconductor packages regularly.

item.title: RStudio and R Markdown Tips
item.description:
Here are some miscellaneous tips for working on RStudio and writing R Markdown file. This blog will be updated from time to time.

See also:

  • RStudio Cheatsheets

item.title: Setup RStudio Server Over Nginx Https
item.description:
I have introduced how to install R and RStudio Server before. But free version of RStudio Server lack of many security features, especially SSL.

This post introduces to secure RStudio Server by an Nginx reverse proxy.

item.title: Install R and RStudio server in Debian
item.description: This post introduces how to complie latest R for RStidio, and install RStudio Server in a Debian host.

item.title: Install hdf5r package in R 4.0.2
item.description:
While installing the R package “hdf5r” version 1.3.3, I encountered the error:

fatal error: hdf5.h: No such file or directory
 #include <hdf5.h>
          ^~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.

My OS is Debian buster/10.6, and the package “libhdf5-dev” has been installed. It looks R cannot find the path of hdf5 header and library files.
